alert.note: Alert for Bowie; Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Little River, northwestern Sevier, southeastern McCurtain, northwestern Bowie and southeastern Red River Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Broken Bow to 10 miles north of Boxelder. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Queen, Horatio, Boxelder, De Kalb, Arkinda, Dalby Springs, Avery, Annona, Haworth, Eagletown, Moon, Cerrogordo, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Lydia, Goodwater, Shinewell, America, West Line and Bokhoma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
